meanings.definition: To put to death painlessly or allow to die, as by withholding extreme medical measures
meanings.sent1: The old dog was euthanized to end his pain.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian euthanized the injured bird to prevent further suffering.
meanings.sent3: The kind owner made the difficult decision to have her beloved pet euthanized.
meanings.sent4: In some cases, euthanizing a terminally ill patient may be the most compassionate choice.
meanings.sent5: The decision to euthanize a pet is never easy, but it can be a merciful act of love.

meanings.definition: To kill in a humane way, especially to end suffering
meanings.sent1: The injured horse had to be euthanized on the spot.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper euthanized the sick tiger to prevent its suffering.
meanings.sent3: The farmer decided to euthanize the old cow to prevent further pain.
meanings.sent4: The decision to euthanize a wild animal is often made to maintain the balance of nature.
meanings.sent5: The humane society works to euthanize stray animals in a caring manner.
